intro: Cheilanthes clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's rockcap, is a member of the fern family, specifically the Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant has a short, upright rhizome with dense, clustered fronds that are leathery and dark green. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. This species is native to the southwestern United States and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
